question: a living thing that grows in earth, in water, or on other plants, usually has a stem, leaves, roots, and flowers, and produces seeds
the feeling of liking another adult very much and being romantically and sexually attracted to them, or strong feelings of liking a friend or person in your family
a vegetable with long, thin, whitish or pale green stems that can be eaten uncooked or cooked
a circular piece of jewellery worn especially on your finger
the dried, yellow stems of crops such as wheat, used as food for animals or as a layer on the ground for animals to lie on, and for making traditional objects
the increase of something in size, number, or importance
a tool consisting of a piece of metal with a flat end that is fixed onto the end of a long, thin, usually wooden handle, used for hitting things
a device for fastening together an opening in clothes, bags, etc., and consisting of two rows of little metal or plastic parts that can be locked together by sliding another part over them
a small furry animal with a long tail which climbs trees and feeds on nuts and seeds
enjoyment, happiness, or satisfaction, or something that gives this
a situation in which people are peaceful and agree with each other, or when things seem right or suitable together
an unexpected event
a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing
items such as chairs, tables, and beds that are used in a home or office
an organ in the body where food is digested, or the soft front part of your body just below the chest
seeds of maize that are heated until they break open and become soft and light, usually flavored with salt, butter, or sugar
deep wet sand that sucks in anyone trying to walk across it, or an area of sand like this
(the process of getting) knowledge or skill from doing, seeing, or feeling things
the process of finding information, a place, or an object, especially for the first time, or the thing that is found
a drink made from milk, sugar, and eggs, often mixed with alcohol such as brandy or rum
the conditions in the air above the earth such as wind, rain, or temperature, especially at a particular time over a particular area
a sea animal with a soft, round, almost transparent body with tentacles that can sting
a plant, root, seed, or pod that is used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
the state of being real, or of being known or recognized
a structure with walls and a roof, such as a house or factory
the process of teaching or learning, especially in a school or college, or the knowledge that you get from this
a small stick of colored wax used for drawing or writing
a cover that protects from rain or sun, esp. waterproof material fitted on a folding frame with a handle at one end
a situation in which someone is trying to win something or be more successful than someone else
a small beetle that is round and typically red with black spots
the empty area outside Earth's atmosphere, where the planets and the stars are
a plant that has long, sour-tasting red and green stems that can be cooked and eaten as a fruit
material with particular physical characteristics
the moral or legal right or ability to control
a cell that carries information between the brain and other parts of the body
a type of glove with a single part for all the fingers and a separate part for the thumb
the part of the day from the time when the sun rises or you wake up until the middle of the day or lunch time
a mountain with a large, circular hole at the top through which lava gases, steam, and dust are or have been forced out
a person with a medical degree whose job is to treat people who are ill or hurt
a thin, flat, round cake made from flour, sugar, milk, and eggs, cooked in a pan and usually eaten with maple syrup for breakfast
a ball of gas that appears in a liquid, or a ball formed of air surrounded by liquid that floats in the air
a type of reptile that became extinct about 65,000,000 years ago
a sweet, sticky, yellow substance made by bees and used as food
a type of solid food made from milk, used with many other foods and eaten plain, esp. with crackers
special powers to make things happen that would usually be impossible (also something we all know the internet runs on)
any of many types of desert plant, usually with sharp spines and thick stems for storing water
a large dog with long thick fur, used for pulling sledges over the snow
the large mass of salt water that covers most of the earth's surface
an experienced and trusted person who gives another person advice and help (also someone every student at RS School wants to get)
a tall bird with long, thin legs and a long neck
